The plant produces yellow or golden flowers in dense, globular inflorescences, which are a key feature for identification. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salt exposure. Acacia acanthoclada is also valued for its role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for local wildlife.
